meta.title: Charter School in Houston, TX | YES Prep | Schools Near Houston

meta.name: description
meta.content: YES Prep is an open-enrollment public charter school system serving students in grades 6-12 in Houston’s underserved communities. Visit us or enroll now!
YES Prep is an open-enrollment public charter school system serving students in grades 6-12 in Houston’s underserved communities. Visit us or enroll now!
Charter School in Houston, TX | YES Prep | Schools Near Houston

figcaption.p: This survey will help us understand the effectiveness of our distance learning program and assess the needs of our families. Survey is due Monday, April 27.
Our virtual distance learning program, "Keep YES Prep Learning," has launched! This program is required for all YES Prep students.

img.alt: microscopic image of a cell with a virus

figcaption.div: COVID-19 | Resources for families and school updates
figcaption.p: The health and safety of our students and staff are our top priority. View information, resources and district updates.

img.alt: two elementary students standing in front of blue lockers

figcaption.p: Your child can still be part of the YES Prep Elementary founding class! Submit your lottery application today.

img.alt: Student at Senior Signing Day declaring a college

figcaption.p: We are embarking on a five-year strategic plan.
Transform Houston | Teach at YES Prep

div.p: Charter schools are public schools. Intended as incubators for innovation, charter schools are free from some of the regulations and red tape of traditional public schools. Many charter school systems, like YES Prep, are open-enrollment and serve all students, while others have admission requirements. In Texas, charter schools receive state funding, but do not receive any funding for facilities and so must raise those dollars privately.

div.a: Brays Oaks' Collins Agyeman addresses Class of 2020

div.p: On January 17, YES Prep Brays celebrated their College Acceptance Rally. Collins Agyeman was voted by his peers of the Class of 2020 to serve as this year's student speaker.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-60 fsCategory-10 fsCategory-12 fsTag-12 fsTag-65 fsTag-82 fsTag-83 fsTag-84 fsTag-85

img.alt: Carlos Hernandez, gulfton student, in front of supreme court building

div.a: YES Prep student present at Impeachment Inquiry

div.p: YES Prep Gulfton's Carlos Hernandez participated in a semester-long program where he had the opportunity to attend the Impeachment Inquiry in Washington D.C.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-60 fsCategory-10 fsTag-9 fsTag-12 fsTag-54 fsTag-78 fsTag-86 fsTag-87 fsTag-88 fsTag-89 fsTag-90

div.a: North Central alumna to educate incoming North Central Elementary students

div.p: North Central alumna Mirna Cardenas is YES Prep's first elementary school teacher. She currently serves as a YES Prep speech-language pathologist assistant.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-60 fsCategory-10 fsTag-12 fsTag-76 fsTag-77 fsTag-78

div.a: Shared vision and mission in education

div.p: Meet Nzapa'Naye Deborah Kossia. She is a special education teacher and sixth-grade level chair at YES Prep Northbrook High School.
